This may only cause a target to lose at most one Tick of Hit Points, no matter how many items they were holding. On each of the target's subsequent turns, if it is still holding the item(s) in question it loses a Tick of Hit Points.

name: Population Bomb
effects: Roll Accuracy for this Move 3 times. If one of these rolls succeeds, this Move hits. For each successful roll after the first, choose one of the following additional effects: » The target is Vulnerable until the end of their next turn. » The target's Moves are resisted 1 step further until the end of their next turn. » This Move's damage cannot be resisted. If one or more of the rolls crit, this Move is a Critical Hit, and you may choose an additional effect.

name: Pounce
effects: After dealing damage, the target is Slowed for 1 round. A target may only be Slowed by this Move once per Scene. +1

name: Powder
effects: The target is dusted with a Coat of flammable powder. If it uses a damaging Fire-Type attack, the attack is negated and instad creates a Blast 3 centered on itself as the powder explodes, and the Coat is removed. All targets within the Blast take damage equal to what the user of the Fire-Type attack would roll for the damage of their attack. This damage is Typeless or Fire-Type, whichever would be more effective.

name: Powder Snow
effects: Powder Snow Freezes all Legal Targets on 19+.

name: Power Shift
effects: The user's Attack stat and Defense stat are switched and the user's Special Attack stat and Special Defense stat are switched. These changes last for the remainder of the scene, or until the user is switched out or Fainted.

name: Power Split
effects: The target has their Attack and Special Attack lowered by 5. If they do, the user gains a +5 bonus to Damage Rolls. These effects last until the end of the scene.

name: Power Swap
effects: The user and the target trade Combat Stage values for the Attack Stat, and then for the Special Attack Stat.

name: Power Trick
effects: The user's Attack stat and Defense stat are switched for the remainder of the scene, or until the user is switched out or Fainted.

name: Power Trip
effects: This Move gains +2 to its Damage Base for every positive Combat Stage held by the user, to a maximum of DB 20.

name: Power-Up Punch
effects: If Power-Up Punch successfully hits a target, the user's Attack is raised by +1 Combat Stage

name: Present
effects: Roll 1d6; Present has a Damage Base equal to twice the result. On a result of 1, instead of taking damage, the target gains 20 Hit Points.

name: Protect
effects: If the user is hit by a Move, the user may use Protect. The user is instead not hit by the Move. You do not take any damage nor are you affected by any of the Move's effects.

name: Psy Kick
effects: The user may push the target up to 2 meters.

name: Psybeam
effects: Psybeam Confuses the target on 19+.

name: Psyblade
effects: This Move deals +10 damage if the user or target are in Electric Terrain.

name: Psych Up
effects: The user's Combat Stages are changed to match the target's Combat Stages. Psych Up cannot miss.

name: Psychic
effects: The target is Pushed 1 meter in any direction. Psychic lowers the target's Special Defense 1 Combat Stage on 17+.

name: Psychic Fangs
effects: Light Screen, Reflect and Aurora Veil cannot be declared in response to Psychic Fangs.

name: Psychic Noise
effects: Choose a legal target. The chosen target may not gain Hit Points or Temporary Hit Points from any source, until it is switched out. This counts as a Volatile Affliction.

name: Psychic Terrain
effects: The Field becomes Weird for five rounds. While the Field is Weird, non-Flying and non-Levitating Pokémon cannot declare Priority or Interrupt Moves outside their own Initiatives. Damaging Psychic-Type attacks deal an additional 10 damage

name: Psycho Boost
effects: Lower the user's Special Attack 2 Combat Stages after damage is resolved.

name: Psycho Cut
effects: Psycho Cut is a Critical Hit on 18+.

name: Psycho Shift
effects: The user is cured of a Status ailment and the target is given that Status ailment. Psycho Shift cannot miss. Psycho Shift can only be used if the user has a Status ailment and the target does not have the status ailment that is being transferred.

name: Psyshield Bash
effects: The user gains +5 DR for one full round.

name: Psyshock
effects: When calculating damage, the target subtracts their Defense from Psyshock's damage instead of their Special Defense. Psyshock is still otherwise Special ( Special Evasion is used to avoid it, Mirror Coat can reflect it, etc. )

name: Psystrike
effects: When calculating damage, the target subtracts their Defense from Psystrike's damage instead of their Special Defense. Psystrike is still otherwise Special (Special Evasion is used to avoid it, Mirror Coat can reflect it, etc.)

name: Psywave
effects: Roll 1d4; on 1 the target loses Hit Points equal to half the user's Level; on 2 the target loses Hit Points equal to the user's Level; on 3 the target loses Hit Points equal to 1.5x the user's level; on 4 the target loses Hit Points equal to the user's Level doubled. Do not apply weakness or resistance, and do not apply Stats. Do apply Immunity.

name: Punishment
effects: Punishment's Damage Base is raised by +1 for each positive Combat Stage the target has, to a maximum of DB 12.

name: Purify
effects: The target is cured of all Permanent and Volatile Statuses. For every status removed, the user recovers a Tick of Hit Points.

name: Pursuit
effects: If the foe is fleeing or being switched out, Pursuit may be used as an Interrupt, targeting the triggering foe. When used as an Interrupt, Pursuit grants the user a +5 bonus to all Movement Speeds, and has a Damage Base of 8 (2d8+10 / 19).

name: Pyro Ball
effects: The target is Burned on 19+.

name: Quash
effects: Quash changes the target's Initiative to 0 for the remainder of the round.

name: Quick Guard
effects: If the user or an adjacent ally is targeted by a Priority or Interrupt Attack, Quick Guard may be declared as an Interrupt, causing the triggering attack to have no effect.

name: Quiver Dance
effects: Raise the user's Special Attack, Special Defense, and Speed by +1 Combat Stage each.

name: Rage

name: Rage Fist
effects: If the user has at least 1 Injury when using this Move, its Damage Base gets doubled to DB 10 (3d8+10 / 24). Additionally, if the user is under 50% Max HP, this Move instead becomes DB 12 (3d12+10 / 30) and cannot miss.

name: Rage Powder
effects: All targets hit by Rage Powder are Enraged. While enraged, they must shift to target the user when using a Move or Attack if the user is within reach. If the user is Fainted or Switched out, all targets hit by Rage Powder are cured of rage.

name: Raging Bull
effects: As a Free Action, the user may change this Move's Type to any Type that the user possesses. Blessings may not be activated in response to this Move.

name: Raging Fury
effects: The user becomes Enraged. Legal targets become Enraged on a 16+.

name: Rain Dance

name: Rapid Spin
effects: Rapid Spin destroys all Hazards within 5 meters, removes Leech Seeds, and removes the user's Trapped or Stuck status. If Rapid Spin hits, the user's speed raises 1 CS.

name: Razor Leaf
effects: Razor Leaf is a Critical Hit on 18+.

name: Razor Shell
effects: Razor Shell lowers the Target's Defense 1 Combat Stage on an Even-Numbered Roll.

name: Recover
effects: The user regains Hit Points equal to half of its full Hit Point value.

name: Recycle
effects: The effect of a consumable item used earlier in the encounter is used again as if it had not been destroyed. The item is still gone.

name: Redline
effects: The target may not make Attacks of Opportunity until the end of the Round. If the target has any positive Combat Stages, it loses them, and this Move is 1 step more Effective. After attacking, the user may Move up to their remaining Movement as a Free Action.

name: Reflect
effects: Blessing – Any user affected by Reflect may activate it when receiving Physical Damage to resist the Damage one step. Reflect may be activated 2 times, and then disappears.

name: Reflect Type
effects: Reflect Type changes one of the user's Types into one Type of your choice that the target has for the rest of the scene.

name: Refresh
effects: The user is cured of all Poison, Burns, and Paralysis.

name: Relic Song
effects: All Legal Targets fall Asleep on 16+. As long as Meloetta knows Relic Song, it may change between Aria Form and Step Form as a Swift Action when using Relic Song, or as a Standard Action otherwise. Both Aria and Step Form must be statted with the same HP Stat.

name: Rest
effects: The user is set to their full Hit Point value. The user is cured of any Status ailments. Then, the user falls Asleep. The user cannot make Sleep Checks at the beginning of their turn. They are cured of the Sleep at the end of their turn in 2 rounds.

name: Retaliate
effects: Retaliate's Damage Base is doubled to DB 14 (4d10+15 / 40) if an ally has been Fainted by a Damaging Move used by the Target in the last 2 rounds of Combat.

name: Return
effects: Return's Damage Base is equal to 3 plus the user's Loyalty Value.

name: Revelation Dance
effects: Revelation Dance is the same Type as the user's primary Type (the first one listed in the Pokédex). Revelation Dance deals +5 Bonus Damage for every other Dance Move used by the user this round, to a maximum of +15.

name: Revenge
effects: When declaring Revenge, the user does nothing and may not Shift. At the end of the round, the user may shift and use Revenge. If the target has damaged the user this round, Revenge has a Damage Base of 12 (3d12+10 / 30).

name: Reversal
effects: For each Injury the user has, Reversal's Damage Base is increased by +1.

name: Revival Blessing
effects: An ally that Fainted this Scene may use a Move as a Free Action as if they were not Fainted, originating from a square adjacent to the user. The chosen ally may be a Pokémon in a Poké Ball.

name: Rising Voltage
effects: After Rising Voltage is resolved, you may create Electric Terrain in a Blast 7, centered on the user, that lasts for 5 turns. Any creatures in those spaces are affected as if by the Field Move Electric Terrain, rather than any other Field Move. This Effect may trigger only once per Scene.

name: Roar
effects: When declaring Roar, the user does nothing and may not Shift. At the end of the round, the user Shifts and uses Roar. Targets hit by Roar immediately Shift away from the target using their highest usable movement capability, and towards their Trainer if possible. If the target is an owned Pokémon and ends this shift within 6 meters of their Poké Ball, they are immediately recalled to their Poké Ball. If that Trainer sends out a replacement, they do not lose their Pokémon turn.

name: Roar of Time
effects: All legal targets are Slowed, even if the attack misses.

name: Rock Climb
effects: Rock Climb Confuses the target on 17+.

name: Rock Polish
effects: Raise the user's Speed 2 Combat Stages.

name: Rock Slide
effects: Rock Slide Flinches all Legal Targets on 17+.

name: Rock Smash
effects: Rock Smash lowers the target's Defense 1 Combat Stage on 17+.

name: Rock Tomb
effects: Rock Tomb lowers the target's Speed by -1 Combat Stage.

name: Role Play
effects: The user gains one of the target's Abilities, chosen at random, for the remainder of the encounter. This effect ends if the user Faints or is switched out. Role Play cannot miss.

name: Rolling Kick
effects: Rolling Kick Flinches the target on 15+.

name: Rollout
effects: The user continues to use Rollout on each of its turns until they miss any target with Rollout, or are not able to hit any target with Rollout during their turn. Each successive use of Rollout increases Rollout's Damage Base by +4 to a maximum of DB 15.

name: Roost
effects: The user regains Hit Points equal to half of its full Hit Points. If the user is a Flying Type, it loses the Flying Type until the start of their next turn.

name: Rototiller
effects: All Grass-type Pokémon in the area raise their Attack and Special Attack 1 Combat Stage.

name: Round
effects: Round's Damage Base is equal to 6, plus +2 more for each previous use of Round by any Trainer or Pokémon this round, up to a maximum of DB12.

name: Ruination
effects: The target becomes Cursed and Vulnerable until it is switched out.

name: Sacred Fire
effects: Sacred Fire Burns the target on Even-Numbered Rolls.

name: Sacred Sword
effects: Sacred Sword cannot miss.

name: Safeguard
effects: Blessing – Any user affected by Safeguard may activate it when receiving a Status Affliction to ignore the effects of that Status Affliction on their next turn. Safeguard may be activated 3 times, and then disappears.

name: Salt Cure
effects: The target becomes Lightly Salted as a Volatile Affliction. While Lightly Salted, they lose 1 Tick of HP at the beginning of each of their turns. Water and Steel-Type Pokemon hit by Salt Cure lose 2 Ticks of HP instead.

name: Sand Attack
effects: The target is Blinded until the end of their next turn.

name: Sand Tomb
effects: The target is put in a Vortex.

name: Sandstorm
effects: The weather changes to a Sandstorm for 5 rounds. While it is Sandstorming, all non-Ground, Rock, or Steel Type Pokémon lose a Tick of Hit Points at the beginning of their turn.

name: Sandstorm Sear
effects: The target is Burned on a 15+

name: Scald
effects: Scald Burns the target on 15+.

name: Scale Shot
effects: The user's Speed is raised 1 CS, and the user's Defense is lowered 1 CS.

name: Scary Face
effects: The target's Speed is lowered 2 Combat Stages.

name: Scorching Sands
effects: Scorching Sands Burns the target on 15+.

name: Screech
effects: All Legal Targets have their Defense lowered 2 Combat Stages.

name: Searing Shot
effects: Searing Shot Burns all targets on 15+.

name: Secret Power
effects: Secret Power's effect depends on Environ. Secret Power's effect activates on 17+.

name: Secret Sword
effects: When calculating damage, the target subtracts their Defense from Secret Sword's damage instead of their Special Defense. Secret Sword is still otherwise Special ( Special Evasion is used to avoid it, Mirror Coat can reflect it, etc. ).

name: Seed Flare
effects: All Legal Targets have their Special Defense lowered 1 Combat Stage.

name: Seismic Toss
effects: The target loses Hit Points equal to the level of Seismic Toss' user.

name: Self-Destruct
effects: The user's Hit Points are set to -50% of their full Hit Point value. This Hit Point loss may not be prevented or reduced in any way. The user's loyalty toward its trainer may be lowered.

name: Shadow Ball
effects: Shadow Ball lowers the foe's Special Defense 1 Combat Stage on 17+.

name: Shadow Bone
effects: The target's Defense is lowered by 1 Combat Stage on a 17+.

name: Shadow Claw
effects: Shadow Claw is a Critical Hit on 18+.

name: Shadow Punch
effects: Shadow Punch cannot miss.

name: Sharpen
effects: Raise the user's Attack 1 Combat Stage.

name: Shed Tail
effects: If the user is hit by a Move while above 1/4th Hit Points, after being told how much damage it would deal, they may use this Move. The user is instead not hit by the triggering Move, and does not take any damage, nor are they affected by any of the Move's effects. Instead, they lose 1/4th of their maximum Hit Points. This Hit Point loss cannot be prevented in any way. The user may then Disengage up to their full Movement as a Free Action, or be switched out, even if they are Trapped. They leave behind a Tail Token on any one square they occupied. The Tail Token counts as Rough Terrain for foes, and if an ally Shifts over it, they may remove it from the field to gain the same amount of Temporary Hit Points as the user lost when activating this Move. This Move may not be activated against Moves with the Sonic keyword.

name: Sheer Cold
effects: Roll 1d100. This roll may not be modified in any way. If you roll X or lower, the target Faints. X is equal to 30 + The User's Level - The Target's Level.

name: Shell Side Arm
effects: This attack uses the highest of the user's Attack or Special Attack Stat, though this does not change the Class of the Move. In addition, if the target's Defense is lower than its Special Defense, this attack targets Defense, becoming a Physical Move. The target is poisoned on a 17+.

name: Shell Smash
effects: Raise the user's Attack 2 Combat Stages, raise the user's Special Attack 2 Combat Stages and raise the user's Speed 2 Combat Stages. Lower the user's Defense 1 Combat Stage and lower the user's Special Defense 1 Combat Stage.

name: Shell Trap
effects: If the user is hit by a Melee attack, they may use Shell Trap as an Interrupt.

name: Shelter
effects: The user gains +1 CS in Defense and Special Defense, and +2 Evasion.

name: Shift Gear
effects: Raise the user's Attack 1 Combat Stage and raise the user's Speed 2 Combat Stages.

name: Shock Wave
effects: Shock Wave cannot miss.

name: Shore Up
effects: The user regains Hit Points equal to half of its full Hit Point value. If it is Sand Storming, the user gains 2/3 of its full Hit Point value instead. If it is Sunny, Rainy or Hailing the user gains 1/4 of their full Hit Point value instead.

name: Signal Beam
effects: Signal Beam confuses the target on 19+.

name: Silk Trap
effects: If the user is hit by a Move, the user may use this Move. The user is instead not hit by the triggering Move. You do not take any damage nor are you affected by any of the Move's effects. In addition, if the triggering Move was Melee ranged, the attacker's Speed is lowered by -2 Combat Stages and they are Slowed until the end of the user's next turn. If the target already has negative Speed Combat Stages, the target is Stuck and Trapped instead of Slowed.

name: Silver Wind
effects: On 19+, the user has each of its stats raised by +1 Combat Stage.

name: Simple Beam
effects: You choose one of the target's Abilities. Simple Beam changes that Ability to Simple for the remainder of the encounter.

name: Sing
effects: All legal Targets fall Asleep. On a miss, Sing instead causes targets to become Slowed and suffer a -2 penalty to their Evasion until the end of the user's next turn.

name: Sketch
effects: Sketch cannot miss. Once Sketch has been used, remove Sketch from the user's Move list. The last Move that the target used is added to the user's Move list permanently. Sketch may not be Interrupted or Intercepted.

name: Skill Swap
effects: The user loses one of their Abilities, selected by the user, and gains one the target's Abilities, selected at random, for the remainder of encounter. The target loses the copied Ability, and gains the user's lost Ability. This effect ends if either the target or the user is Switched out or Fainted, but only for that Pokémon or Trainer.

name: Skitter Smack
effects: The user Shifts up to its Overland Capability, ignoring Attacks of Opportunity, before attacking with Skitter Smack. On a hit, the target's Special Attack is lowered 1 CS.

name: Sky Uppercut
effects: Sky Uppercut may be used as an Interrupt when against a target initiating Bounce, Fly, or Sky Drop to allow the user to Shift and use Sky Uppercut. If Sky Uppercut successfully hits its target, the triggering Move fails (though the target may take their next turn normally).

name: Slack Off
effects: The user regains Hit Points equal to half of its full Hit Points.

name: Slam
effects: Slam may be used as a Free Action at the end of a Sprint Maneuver taken as a Standard Action, as long as the user Shifted at least 3 meters in a straight line towards the target. When used this way, Slam gains the Smite keyword.

name: Slash
effects: Slash is a Critical Hit on 18+.

name: Sleep Powder
effects: The target falls asleep.

name: Sleep Talk
effects: Select another of the user's Moves at random; this turn, the user may Shift and use that Move despite being Asleep. Sleep Talk can be only be used by Sleeping targets.

name: Sludge
effects: Sludge Poisons the target on 15+.

name: Sludge Bomb
effects: Sludge Bomb Poisons the target on 15+.

name: Sludge Wave
effects: Sludge Wave Poisons targets on 19+.

name: Smack Down
effects: The target is knocked down to ground level, and loses all Sky or Levitate Speeds for 3 turns. During this time, they may be hit by Ground-Type Moves even if normally immune.

name: Smart Strike
effects: Smart Strike cannot miss.

name: Smelling Salts
effects: If the target is Paralyzed, Smelling Salt's Damage Base is doubled to 14 (4d10+15 / 40), and cures the target of Paralysis.

name: Smog
effects: Smog Poisons the target on an Even-Numbered Roll.

name: Smokescreen
effects: Smokescreen creates a blast of Smoke that covers the target area; the Smoke persists until the end of the encounter, or until Defog or Whirlwind are used. All targets attacking from or into the Smoke receive a -3 penalty to Accuracy.

name: Snap Trap
effects: The target is trapped in a Vortex. The DC to escape the Vortex is increased by 3.

name: Snarl
effects: All Legal Targets have their Special Attack lowered 1 Combat Stage.

name: Snatch
effects: If the target uses a Self-Targeting Move, you may use Snatch. You gain the benefits of the Self-Targeting Move instead of the target.

name: Snipe Shot
effects: Snipe Shot is a Critical Hit on 18+. This Move may not be Intercepted, nor may any Abilities, Moves, or Features be activated to change this Move's target. Any of those existing effects (such as Follow Me) fail.

name: Snore
effects: Snore Flinches all legal targets on 15+. Snore may only be used by Sleeping users.

name: Snowscape
effects: The weather changes to Snowy for 5 rounds. While it is Snowing, all Ice-Type Pokémon gain 5 Damage Reduction, or +2 to any existing Damage Reduction. NOTE: For all intents and purposes, Snowscape retroactively replaces Hail in all contexts, including Movepools and Ability effects. If you are using the Weathers from Domovoi's Rework however, Snowscape should be replaced again with Hail from that Homebrew in anything but Name.

name: Soak
effects: The target gains the Water Type in addition to its other Types for 5 turns.

name: Soft-Boiled
effects: The target regains Hit Points equal to half of its full Hit Points. The user may target themselves with Soft-Boiled.

name: Sonic Boom
effects: Sonic Boom causes the target to lose 15 Hit Points. Sonic Boom is Special and interacts with other moves and effects as such ( Special Evasion may be applied to avoid it, Mirror Coat can reflect it, etc. )

name: Spacial Rend
effects: Spacial Rend is a Critical Hit on Even-Numbered Rolls.

name: Spark
effects: Spark Paralyzes the target on 15+.

name: Sparkling Aria
effects: When you hit a target with Sparkling Aria, the user may choose to deal no damage and instead cure that target of Burn, Confusion, Infatuation, or Rage.

name: Spectral Thief
effects: Before rolling damage, transfer all Combat Stages on the target to the user.

name: Speed Swap
effects: The user and the target trade Initiative values.

name: Spicy Extract
effects: Choose either Attack or Special Attack. Raise the chosen Stat of the user or an ally within range by +3 Combat Stages. You cannot make the same choice twice in the same Scene.

name: Spider Web
effects: Spider Web cannot miss. The target is Stuck and Trapped. If the user is freed of the Stuck condition, they are freed of Trapped as well.

name: Spikes
effects: Set 8 square meters of Spikes within your range, all 8 meters must be adjacent with at least one other space of Spikes. Spikes cause terrain to count as Slow Terrain, and a grounded foe that runs into the hazards will lose a Tick of Hit Points and become Slowed until the end of their next turn.

name: Spiky Shield
effects: If the user is hit by an attack, the user may use Spiky Shield. The user is instead not hit by the Move. You do not take any damage nor are you affected by any of the Move's effects. In addition, if the triggering attack was Melee ranged, the attacker loses a Tick of Hit Points.

name: Spin Out
effects: This Move may be used as a Free Action at the end of a Sprint Maneuver taken as a Standard Action, as long as the user Shifted at least 3 meters in a straight line and ended in range of a target. When used this way, this Move gains the Smite keyword, and lowers the user's Speed by -2 Combat Stages.

name: Spirit Break
effects: The target's Special Attack stat is lowered 1 CS.

name: Spirit Shackle
effects: The Target is Trapped for 2 rounds.

name: Spit Up
effects: For each Stockpiled Count the user has, Spit Up's Damage Base is increased by +8. If the user has no Stockpiled count, Spit Up cannot be used.

name: Spite
effects: Spite may be used as a Free Action that does not take up a Command whenever the user is hit by a Move. That Move becomes Disabled for the attacker.

name: Splash
effects: Shift Action - The user may make a single Jump, adding +1 to their Long Jump and High Jump values, and gains +2 Evasion until the end of their next turn.

name: Spook
effects: Lower the target's Special Defense by -1 Combat Stage on 18+.

name: Spore
effects: The target falls Asleep.

name: Spotlight
effects: Until the end of the user's next turn, the target is Blinded and Vulnerable.

name: Springtide Storm
effects: If the user is not in Therian Forme, the user has each of its stats raised by +1 CS on a 16+. If the user is in Therian Form, the target has each of its stats lowered by -1 CS on a 16+.

name: Stealth Rock
effects: Set 4 square meters of Stealth Rock hazards within 6 meters. If a foe moves within 2 meters of a space occupied by Rocks, move at most one Rock to the offender, then destroy the Rock. When that happens, the Stealth Rock causes a foe to lose a Tick of Hit Points. Stealth Rock is considered to be dealing damage; Apply Weakness and Resistance. Do not apply stats. A Pokémon who has been hit by a Stealth Rock Hazard cannot get hit by another in the same encounter until it is returned to a Poké Ball and then sent back out.

name: Steam Eruption
effects: Steam Eruption burns all legal targets on a 15+.

name: Steamroller
effects: Steamroller Flinches the target on 15+. If the target is Small, Steamroller deals an additional +5 Damage.

name: Steel Beam
effects: The user's Hit Points are reduced by 50% of their full Hit Point value. This Hit Point loss cannot be prevented or reduced in any way.

name: Steel Roller
range: Melee, Pass, Dash, Smite, Spirit Surge
effects: Legal targets hit by Steel Roller are Tripped on a roll of 15+. Any Hazards in spaces Passed through or adjacent to those spaces are removed (they are removed before they can affect the user). If the user moves through an area of Terrain, or a Field-range Terrain is active, those effects immediately end.

name: Steel Wing
effects: Raise the user's Defense 1 Combat Stage on 15+.

name: Sticky Web
effects: Set 8 square meters of Sticky Web hazards within your range, all 8 meters must be adjacent with at least one other space of Sticky Web. Sticky Web causes Terrain to become Slow Terrain, and a foe that runs into the hazard has its Speed lowered by one stage, and they become Slowed until the end of their next turn. Flying- type Pokémon and Pokémon and Trainers with Levitate are not affected by Sticky Web. Bug-type Pokémon may move over Sticky Web harmlessly, destroying the Hazards as they do so.

name: Stockpile
effects: The user adds 1 to their Stockpiled count to a maximum of 3. For each number a Stockpiled count is above 0, raise the user's Defense 1 Combat Stage and raise the user's Special Defense 1 Combat Stage. If a Stockpiled count is set to 0, the Combat Stages gained from the Stockpiled count are removed.

name: Stomp
effects: Stomp Flinches the target on 15+. If the target is at least one size category smaller than the user, Stomp deals an additional 10 damage.

name: Stomping Tantrum
effects: If the user's last attack failed or missed, Stomping Tantrum is DB 15 (4d10+10 / 45) instead.

name: Stone Axe
effects: Stone Axe is a critical hit on an 18+. Once per scene, on a hit, the target may be put in a Vortex.

name: Stone Edge
effects: Stone Edge is a Critical Hit on 17+.

name: Stored Power
effects: For every Combat Stage the user has above 0, add +2 to Stored Power's Damage Base, up to a maximum of DB20.

name: Storm Throw
effects: If Storm Throw hits, it is a Critical Hit.

name: Strange Steam
effects: The target is confused on 17+.

name: Strength
effects: You may immediately initiate a Push Maneuver as a Free Action. The Maneuver automatically hits, but you must still make the Opposed Roll.

name: Strength Sap
effects: The user gains Hit Points equal to the higher of the target's Attack or Special Attack; the target then loses 1 Combat Stage in that Stat.

name: String Shot
effects: Targets have their Speed CS lowered by -1. If this lowers their Speed CS to -6, or if their Speed CS was already at -6, the target is instead Stuck.

name: Struggle Bug
effects: On hit, lowers the target's Special Attack by -1 CS.

name: Stuff Cheeks
effects: The user immediately consumes one of its Food Buffs, regardless of any conditions that need to be met, gaining its benefit if applicable. If a Buff is consumed, the user's Defense CS is raised by 2.

name: Stun Spore
effects: The target is Paralyzed.

name: Submission
effects: On an accuracy roll of 15+, the target is Tripped.

name: Substitute
effects: The user loses 1/4 of their maximum Hit Points. This Hit Point loss cannot be prevented in any way. The user creates an Illusory Substitute Coat, which has Hit Points equal to 1/4th of the user's full Hit Points +1. If the user would be hit by a Move or attack, instead the Substitute gets hit. Apply weakness, resistance and stats to the Substitute. The Substitute is immune to Status Afflictions and Status Moves. Moves with the Social or Sonic keywords completely ignore and bypass the Substitute. Once the Substitute has been destroyed, the user may be hit as normal. Substitute cannot be used if the user has less than 1/4 of their full Hit Points.

name: Sucker Punch
effects: If an adjacent foe targets the user with a Damaging Attack, Sucker Punch may be used as an Interrupt Move against the triggering foe.

name: Sugar Rush
effects: The user Shifts before or after attacking, ignoring Slow Terrain. If the user did not move through Slow Terrain during this Shift, raise the user's Speed 1 Combat Stage.

name: Sunny Day
effects: The weather becomes Sunny for 5 rounds. While Sunny, Fire-Type Attacks gain a +5 bonus to Damage Rolls, and Water-Type Attacks suffer a -5 Damage penalty.

name: Sunsteel Strike
effects: This Move ignores any Abilities that would cause it to fail or miss, such as Dodge or Wonder Guard; those Abilities cannot be activated in response to Sunsteel Strike.

name: Super Fang
effects: The target loses 1/2 of their current Hit Points.

name: Supercell Slam
effects: If this Move misses, the user loses Hit Points equal to 1/4th of their Max Hit Points. A failure to hit due to a Move with the Shield keyword does not count as a miss. This Move cannot be used if Gravity is in effect.

name: Superpower
effects: Superpower lowers the user's Attack and Defense by 1 Combat Stage each.

name: Supersonic
effects: The target becomes Confused. On miss, the target suffers a -2 penalty to Accuracy Rolls for one full round.

name: Surf
effects: As a Shift Action, the user may Move to any open square in Surf's area of effect without provoking any Attacks of Opportunity.

name: Surge
effects: The target cannot make Attacks of Opportunity for 1 full round.

name: Surging Strikes
effects: If Surging Strikes hits, it is a Critical Hit. After attacking with Surging Strikes, hit or miss, the user may Shift 2m, ignoring Attacks of Opportunity from their target. It may then make an additional attack with this Move on a different target. This effect may be repeated a second time, the third attack targeting a creature that has not yet been targeted by either prior attack. Before making each attack roll, the user can elect to give up triggering all remaining additional shifts and attacks. Surging Strikes gains +3 DB for each attack that is given up.

name: Swagger
effects: The target's Attack is raised 2 Combat Stages. Swagger Confuses the target.

name: Swallow
effects: If the user's Stockpiled count is 1, they are healed 25% of their full Hit Point value; if their Stockpiled count is 2, they are healed half of their full Hit Point value; if their Stockpiled count is 3, they are healed back to full Hit Points. After using Swallow, the user's Stockpiled count is set to 0. If the user has no Stockpiled count, Swallow does nothing.

name: Sweet Kiss
effects: The target becomes Confused. On miss, the target suffers a -2 penalty to Accuracy Rolls for one full round.

name: Sweet Scent
effects: Targets hit by Sweet Scent gain a -2 Penalty to Evasion. (Total Evasion may not be lowered to a negative value. )

name: Swift
effects: Swift cannot Miss.

name: Switcheroo
effects: The user and the target exchange Held Items or Accessory Slot Items.

name: Swords Dance
effects: The user's Attack is raised 2 Combat Stages.

name: Synchronoise
effects: Synchronoise can only hit targets that share a type with Synchronoise's user.

name: Synthesis
effects: The user regains Hit Points equal to half of its full Hit Point value. If it is Sunny, the user gains 2/3 of its full Hit Point value instead. If it is Rainy, Sand Storming or Hailing the user gains 1/4 of their full Hit Point value instead.

name: Syrup Bomb
effects: The target and all foes adjacent to them are Slowed for 1 full Round. If an affected foe was already Slowed or Stuck, it becomes Stuck instead.

name: Tachyon Cutter
effects: If the targets are not adjacent to each other, this Move cannot miss.

name: Tackle
effects: The target is pushed 2 Meters.

name: Tail Glow
effects: Raise the user's Special Attack 3 Combat Stages.

name: Tail Whip
effects: All legal targets have their Defense lowered by 1 Combat Stage.

name: Tailwind
effects: For the remainder of the encounter, all allied trainers and Pokémon gain +5 to their Initiative. Multiple instances of Tailwind cannot stack.

name: Take Down
effects: You may perform a Trip Maneuver against the target as a Free Action.

name: Take Heart
effects: The user gains +1 CS in all its stats and cures all of its Status conditions.

name: Tar Shot
effects: The target gains a Coat that is automatically expended upon being hit with a Fire Type attack in order to make them one step more vulnerable to that attack. In addition, the target's Speed is lowered by 1 CS.

name: Taunt
effects: The target becomes Enraged.

name: Tearful Look
effects: Tearful Look lowers all Legal Targets' Attack and Special Attack 1 Combat Stage.

name: Teatime
effects: All participants in the battle may choose to immediately consume one of their Food Buffs, regardless of if the conditions to do so are met.

name: Techno Blast
effects: Techno Blast's Type can be any Type while holding the appropriate Drive item or Plate item.

name: Teeter Dance
effects: Teeter Dance Confuses all Legal Targets.

name: Telekinesis
effects: The target becomes Lifted. While Lifted, they gain the Levitate Ability, are Slowed, and lose all Movement Capabilities except for the Levitate 4 granted by Levitate (reduced to 2 by the Slow condition). While Lifted, the user may not apply any Evasion bonuses to determine whether they are hit by Moves or not. The Lifted target may use a Shift Action to roll 1d20; on a result of 16+, they stop being Lifted.

name: Teleport
effects: The user Teleports up to X meters, where X is its Teleporter Capability. Teleport can be used as an Interrupt at any time. Moves that targeted Teleport's user continue through the desired target's space if the Move allows for it as if the user hadn't been there; single target moves simply miss.

name: Temper Flare
effects: If the user's last attack failed or missed, this Move is DB 15 (4d10+10 / 45) instead.

name: Tera Blast
effects: If the user is Terastalized, this move's Type becomes the user's Tera Type.

name: Tera Starstorm
effects: Place a Star Shard in any square of the Area of Effect. Any ally entering that square, or starting their turn on it, may consume the Shard to gain a +10 Damage Bonus on their next successful damaging attack. If a target has changed Forme, this attack is one step more effective against that target. This may not cause the Effectiveness to be raised above Doubly Super Effective. Note: Changing Forme includes any effect that switches Base Stat Sets, such as the Abilities like Stance Change or Schooling; Mega Evolution; Dynamax; Terastilization; or being in any Altered, Origin, or Primal Forme; even if they started the encounter that way.

name: Terrain Pulse
effects: If the user is under the effects of a Terrain, Terrain Pulse has a Damage Base of 10 (3d8+10 / 24). In addition, Terrain Pulse becomes the Type that corresponds with the Move that creates that Terrain. (For example, if in Misty Terrain, it would become Fairy Type.) If the user is under the effects of multiple Terrains, choose one to affect this Move.

name: Thief
effects: Thief takes the target's Held Item or Accessory Slot Item and attaches it to Thief's user, if the user is not holding anything.

name: Thousand Arrows
effects: When calculating Weakness and Resistance for Thousand Arrows, Flying-Typed targets calculate damage as if Flying was neutral to Ground. Thousand Arrows ignores the Levitate ability. The target is knocked down to ground level, and loses all Sky or Levitate Speeds for 3 turns. During this time, they may be hit by Ground-Type Moves even if normally immune.

name: Thousand Waves
effects: Legal Targets are Trapped for 2 rounds.

name: Thrash
effects: After damage is dealt, the user becomes Enraged and Confused.

name: Throat Chop
effects: The target cannot use Moves with the Sonic keyword for the next two turns.

name: Thunder
effects: Thunder Paralyzes its target on 15+. If the target is in Sunny Weather, Thunder's Accuracy Check is 11. If the target is in Rainy Weather, Thunder cannot miss. If the target is airborne as a result of Fly or Sky Drop, Thunder cannot miss.

name: Thunder Cage
effects: The targets are trapped in a Vortex. The DC to escape the Vortex is increased by 3.

name: Thunder Fang
effects: Thunder Fang Paralyzes or Flinches on 18- 19 during Accuracy Check; flip a coin to determine whether the foe gets Paralyzed or Flinches. On 20 during Accuracy Check, the foe is Paralyzed and Flinched.

name: Thunder Punch
effects: Thunder Punch Paralyzes the target on 19+.

name: Thunder Shock
effects: Thunder Shock Paralyzes the target on 17+.

name: Thunder Wave
effects: Thunder Wave Paralyzes the target. Targets immune to Electric Attacks are immune to Thunder Wave's effects.

name: Thunderbolt
effects: Thunderbolt Paralyzes the target on 19+.

name: Thunderclap
effects: If a foe within Range uses a damaging Move, or leaves Range, the user may use this Move as an Interrupt against that foe. If they do, the target receives a -10 damage penalty to its next Move, or the triggering one, if any.

name: Thunderous Kick
effects: All legal targets hit lose 1 Defense Combat Stage. Once per Scene, Thunderous Kick may instead be used as an Electric-Type Move.

name: Tickle
effects: Lower the target's Attack 1 Combat Stage and lower the target's Defense 1 Combat Stage.

name: Tidy Up
effects: Choose Slow or Rough Terrain. The chosen Terrain, any Terrain Effects of your choice caused by Moves, and all Hazards are removed from the squares within a Burst 4. Then, the user's Attack and Speed are raised by +1 Combat Stage.

name: Topsy-Turvy
effects: The target's Combat Stages are inverted; +1 Stage becomes -1 Stage, -3 Stages becomes +3 Stages, etc.

name: Torch Song
effects: Raise the Special Attack of either the user or an ally within 3 meters by +1 Combat Stage.

name: Torment
effects: The target becomes Suppressed.

name: Toxic
effects: The target is Badly Poisoned. If the user is Poison Type, Toxic cannot miss.

name: Toxic Spikes
effects: Set 8 square meters of Toxic Spikes, all 8 meters must be adjacent with at least one other space of Toxic Spikes next to each other. Toxic Spikes cause Terrain to become Slow Terrain, and a grounded foe that runs into the hazard becomes Poisoned, and Slowed until the end of their next turn. If there are 2 Layers of Toxic Spikes on the same space, it Deadly Poisons the foes instead. Poison-Type Pokémon may move over Toxic Spikes harmlessly, destroying the Hazards as they do so.

name: Toxic Thread
effects: The target is Poisoned and has their Speed lowered by 1 Combat Stage. If the target is already Poisoned, they instead lose a Tick of Hit Points and has their Speed lowered by 2 Combat Stages.

name: Trailblaze
effects: The user Shifts before or after attacking, ignoring Slow Terrain. If the user did not move through Slow Terrain during this Shift, raise the user's Speed 1 Combat Stage.

name: Transform
effects: The user targets a Pokémon within 10 meters, and assumes the form of the target. It gains all of the user's Moves, gains its Abilities, copies its weight and height and Capabilities. Transform lasts until the user is switched out, KO'd or until the end of the encounter. The user may choose to end the Transformation on its turn as a free action, regaining its previous Move List. The user's Stats do not change from using Transform. Transform cannot miss.

name: Tri Attack
effects: Tri Attack gives the target a Status ailment on 17+ during Accuracy Check. If this effect is triggered, roll 1d3; on 1 the target is Paralyzed; on 2 the target is Burned; on 3 the target is Frozen.

name: Trick
effects: Both targets must be hit for Trick to succeed. The user may target itself or willing allies with Trick; you do not need to roll for Accuracy Check in these cases. Both targets lose their Held Item or Accessory Slot Item, and gain the other target's Held Item or Accessory Slot Item. If a target has no Item, it still can gain the other target's Item.

name: Trick Room
effects: Starting at the beginning of the next round, for 5 rounds, the area is considered Rewinding. While Rewinding, Initiative is reversed, and participants instead go from lowest Initiative to Highest.

name: Trick-or-Treat
effects: The target gains the Ghost Type in addition to its other Types for 5 turns.

name: Triple Arrows
effects: Targets hit by Triple Arrows lose 1 CS in both Defense and Special Defense. After attacking with Triple Arrows, hit or miss, the user may Disengage 2m and attack a different target with Triple Arrows. This effect may be repeated a second time, targeting a creature that has not been targeted by either prior attack. Before making each attack roll, the user can elect to give up triggering all remaining additional shifts and attacks. Triple Arrows gains +1 Accuracy and +1 DB for each attack that is given up. Triple Arrows always benefits from the Technician Ability. Once Daily, after all attacks with Triple Arrows have been resolved, the user becomes Pumped. While Pumped, the user's Critical Range is extended by 2, or 18+ if the Critical Range is not otherwise extended. Being switched will cause this effect to end.

name: Triple Axel
effects: After attacking with Triple Axel, hit or miss, the user may Disengage 2m and attack a different target with Triple Axel. This effect may be repeated a second time, targeting a creature that has not been targeted by either prior attack. Before making each attack roll, the user can elect to give up triggering all remaining additional shifts and attacks. Triple Axel gains +1 Accuracy and +1 DB for each attack that is given up. Triple Axel always benefits from the Technician Ability.

name: Triple Dive
effects: After attacking, hit or miss, the user may Disengage 2 meters and attack a different target with this Move. This effect may be repeated a second time, targeting a creature that has not been targeted by either prior attack. Before making each Accuracy Check, the user can elect to give up triggering all remaining additional Shifts and attacks. This Move gains +5 to its damage roll for each attack that is given up.

name: Triple Kick
effects: After attacking with Triple Kick, hit or miss, the user may Disengage 2m and attack a different target with Triple Kick. This effect may be repeated a second time, targeting a creature that has not been targeted by either prior attack. Before making each attack roll, the user can elect to give up triggering all remaining additional shifts and attacks. Triple Kick gains +1 Accuracy and +2 DB for each attack that is given up. Triple Kick always benefits from the Technician Ability.

name: Trop Kick
effects: The target receives a -5 penalty to damage rolls for 1 round.

name: Trump Card
effects: Whenever Trump Card is used, the user gains a Trump Count after the attack is resolved. Trump Card's Damage Base is increased by +2 for each Trump Count.

name: Twin Beam
effects: If used on only 1 target, this Move gains the Double Strike keyword.

name: Twineedle
effects: Twineedle Poisons the target on an Accuracy Check of 18+

name: Twister
effects: Small or Medium targets in the central square of the blast are not hit. Twister Flinches the target on 18-20 during Accuracy Check. Any Pokémon Airborne as a result of Fly or Sky Drop above the Blast are hit, ignoring range, and Twister has a Damage Base of 8 against those targets instead.

name: U-Turn
effects: If U-Turn successfully hits its target, the user deals damage and then immediately is returned to its Poké Ball in the same turn. A New Pokémon may immediately be sent out. Using U-Turn lets a Trapped user be recalled.

name: Upper Hand
effects: If an adjacent foe declares Priority or an Interrupt, this Move may be used as an Interrupt against the triggering foe. If used this way, this Move Flinches the target. If the triggering Interrupt was itself triggered by the user's Standard Action, that Action is relinquished, in favor of giving up the Action on the following round, to use this Move.

name: Uproar
effects: All Pokémon and Trainers within 5 meters of the user are cured of sleep.

name: V-Create
effects: Lower the user's Defense, Special Defense, and Speed by 1 CS each.

name: Venom Drench
effects: All Poisoned targets have their Attack, Special Attack, and Speed lowered by 1 Combat Stage. Venom Drench cannot miss.

name: Venoshock
effects: If the target is Poisoned, Venoshock has a Damage Base of 13 (4d10+10 / 35) instead.

name: Victory Dance
effects: If the user performs a Fighting Move on their next turn that deals damage, add its Damage Dice Roll an extra time to the damage. Raise the user's Defense 1 Combat Stage.

name: Vital Throw
effects: If the user is targeted by a Melee attack and has not yet taken a turn this round, the user may declare Vital Throw. After the triggering attack is resolved, the user may use Vital Throw against the triggering foe as a Reaction. Vital Throw cannot miss.

name: Volt Switch
effects: If Volt Switch successfully hits its target, the user deals damage and then immediately is returned to its Poké Ball in the same turn. A New Pokémon may immediately be sent out. Using Volt Switch lets a Trapped user be recalled.

name: Volt Tackle
effects: Volt Tackle Paralyzes the target on 19+.

name: Wake-Up Slap
effects: If the target is Asleep, Wake-Up Slap has a Damage Base of 10 (3d8+10 / 24) instead, and cures the target of Sleep.

name: Water Pledge
effects: If an ally uses Fire Pledge or Grass Pledge, you may use Water Pledge as Priority (Advanced) immediately after their turn to target the same foe. If used in conjunction with Fire Pledge, a Rainbow is created that lasts for 5 rounds. If used in conjunction with Grass Pledge, the target and all foes adjacent to the target are slowed and have their Speed reduced by 2 Combat Stages. Consult the Pledge keyword for additional details.

name: Water Pulse
effects: Water Pulse Confuses the target on 17+.

name: Water Sport
effects: All targets in the burst, including the user, gain a Coat which grants them 1 Step of Resistance to Fire Type Moves. After a target has been hit by a damaging Fire Type Move, the coat is removed.

name: Water Spout
effects: For each 10% of HP the user is missing, Water Spout's Damage Base is reduced by 1. Water Spout creates a 1 meter burst, but also affects an area 10 meters tall straight up.

name: Waterfall
effects: Waterfall Flinches the target on 17+.

name: Wave Dash
effects: The user may make the Disengage Maneuver as a Free Action either right before or after using this Move.

name: Weather Ball
effects: If it is Sunny, Weather Ball is Fire-Type. If it is Rainy, Weather Ball is Water-Type. If it is Hailing, Weather Ball is Ice-Type. If it is Sandstorming, Weather Ball is Rock-Type. When a weather effect is on the field, Weather Ball has a Damage Base of 10 (3d8+10 / 24). If there are multiple Weather Effects on the field, choose one type for Weather Ball to be that corresponds with an existing Weather Effect.

name: Whirlpool
effects: The target is put in a Vortex.

name: Whirlwind
effects: All targets are pushed X meters, where X is 8 minus their weight class. If the Line targets into a Smokescreen, the smoke is dispersed. All hazards in the Whirlwind are destroyed.

name: Wicked Blow
effects: If Wicked Blow hits, it is a Critical Hit. The target is Pushed 6 meters minus their Weight Class. On a roll of 15+, the target is also Tripped.

name: Wicked Torque
effects: All legal targets fall Asleep on 18+.

name: Wide Guard
effects: If an Ally adjacent to Wide Guard's user is hit by a Move, you may use Wide Guard as an Interrupt. All targets adjacent to Wide Guard's user, including the user, are instead not hit by the triggering Move and do not suffer any of its effects.

name: Wildbolt Storm
effects: The target is Paralyzed on a 15+.

name: Will-O-Wisp
effects: The target is Burned.

name: Wish
effects: At the end of the user's next turn, the target regains Hit Points equal to half of its full Hit Point value. If the user targets themselves and are replaced in battle, the replacement is healed.

name: Withdraw
effects: The user becomes Withdrawn. While Withdrawn, the user becomes immune to Critical Hits and gain 15 Damage Reduction. However, while Withdrawn, the user cannot Shift, and may only use self-targeting Moves. The user may stop being Withdrawn as a Shift Action.

name: Wither
effects: Suppresses all legal targets on 15+. Any foes adjacent to the target lose 10 Hit Points.

name: Wonder Room
effects: For 5 rounds, the area is considered Wondered. While Wondered, each individual Pokémon's Defense and Special Defense Stats are switched.

name: Work Up
effects: Raise the user's Attack 1 Combat Stage and raise the user's Special Attack 1 Combat Stage.

name: Worry Seed
effects: You choose one of the target's Abilities. Worry Seed changes that Ability to Insomnia for the remainder of the encounter.

name: Wrap
effects: The user gains a +1 Bonus to Accuracy Rolls made to initiate Grapple Maneuvers, and +2 to Skill Checks made to initiate Grapple Maneuvers or gain Dominance. Whenever the user gains Dominance in a Grapple, the target of the Grapple loses a Tick of Hit Points.

name: Wring Out
effects: For every 10% the target is below their full Hit Points, Wring Out's Damage Base is reduced by 1.

name: Yawn
effects: The target falls Asleep at the end of their next turn. Yawn cannot miss.

name: Zantetsuken
effects: This Move automatically Critically Hits targets at or below half of their Max Hit Points. After dealing damage, the target becomes Vulnerable for one full round.

name: Zap Cannon
effects: Zap Cannon Paralyzes the target. Zap Cannon ignores the target's Evasion if there are no other combatants or Rough or Blocking Terrain within 2 meters of the target.

name: Zen Headbutt
effects: Zen Headbutt Flinches the target on 15+.

name: Zing Zap
effects: Zing Zap Flinches the target on 15+.
